security: Revealing that Araujo was reported as an informant for the Cuban 6-2 (security police) and that information was collected from trained Cuban refugees could jeopardize current or future intelligence operations. The document mentions sensitive intelligence sources and methods. Quoting directly: "SUBJECT HAD BEEN REPORTED AS A MILITANT COMMUNIST SINCE 1935...AN INFORMABENT OF THE CUBAN 6-2 (SECURITY POLICE), THIS INFORMATION HAS RECEIVED FROM A GROUP OF CUBAN REFUGEES, TRAINED IN INTELLIGENCE COLLECTION"
summary: This file contains documents related to Leopoldo Araujo Bernal, including information suggesting he was a militant communist and later an informant for Cuban security police. It includes cables and reports from the CIA, FBI, and State Department, focusing on his activities, associations, and travels.
summary_one_paragraph: This file, reviewed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations, compiles documents concerning Leopoldo Araujo Bernal (born June 9, 1912), identified as a potential militant communist since 1935 and later reported as an informant for Cuban security police (6-2) in 1961. The file includes a CIA outgoing message CIR-316/63356-77, dated November 10, 1977, based on information from Cuban refugees trained in intelligence collection. Additional documents consist of State Department records from 1960, FBI reports from 1961-1962, liaison cables from 1966-1971, and CIA cables from 1971. The material covers Araujo's activities, travels, and associations, including his role as president of the Cuban Medical Association.
title: ARAUJO-Bernal, Leopoldo
recipient: Department of State, Federal Bureau of Investigation
